posts.name: Jainish Patel
posts.cooked: How accurate is the Statbotics predicted rank for an event?

posts.name: Silas
posts.cooked: Its pretty good overall, but is absolutely not a replacement for actual scouting data.

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked:
SilasR:

not a replacement for actual scouting data

Actually , Statbotics is a good replacement for bad scouting data.

posts.name: Robertson Robotics
posts.cooked: At what point in time? The predicted rankings change over the course of the event as more data becomes available. You can see this change using the Simulation tab.

At our first event, after the schedule was released we were projected 37th and we finished 3rd, the prediction definitely is most accurate on teams that have already competed or are at a similar level from previous years.

posts.name: Jonathan Taylor
posts.cooked: What I found anecdotally from watching the Statbotics projected rankings at Orlando last weekend for fun, was that it appeared to never predict a 4RP match, so every 4RP match would cause big changes in the predictions.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Good at making robots find walls

posts.custom_user_title: Good at making robots find walls

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked: I expect to see 4RP match predictions from Statbotics as teams demonstrate faster cycles.  The style of play aimed at low row stoking is already emerging, and will become more evident in Week4.

posts.name: Bodi
posts.cooked: We were predicted to be in 18th by Statbotics after match schedule release at our week 1 event, and we placed 3rd in quals and won the event so it really depends. It also becomes more accurate as the season goes on because there is more data available.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
